translation.en: What did I tell you about watching this stuff?
It's a sleepover. What are we supposed to do?
OK, I'm gonna go get ready upstairs.
OK, Mia, I'm gonna be out of your hair in a minute.
Don't worry. I've got it all under control.
Can you keep it down? I'm trying to work.
not that I'd expect a 12-year-old girl
[girl 1] Speaking of songs, have any of you heard of the one
that kills you after you sing it?
-Oh, come on. -[girl 1] I saw it online.
Then it has to be real.
Apparently these boys down in Milford tried it.
They make that stuff up so kids don't believe
If it's not real, there's nothing to be afraid of, right?
What better way to prove it?
[singing hesitantly] ♪ There was a crooked man ♪
-It's not funny! -You should've seen your faces.
-[girl] We didn't do anything! -[girl 1] It was not our fault!
[sighs] I'm late already. Are you guys gonna be OK?
Don't worry. We'll take care of it.
I can check out the circuit breaker.
All right, I will see you guys in the morning.
Please be good for Mia. I love you, kiddo.
-Bye. -[man] Let me go check out the breakers.
I told you it was just the breakers!
Things with your mom and me hadn't been that great
I'm sure she'd love to see you when you get settled.
Do you ever see the other girls?
No one really sees Alice all that much.
I heard that... Charlotte was waitressing at the diner,
-Violet. -Yeah. She was working at a store in town.
She sure had the judge convinced.
The girl who killed her friend.
Six years is a long time, Livy.
[woman] Crazy Olivia's back from the loony bin.
It's a small town. People talk.
You um... You gonna be OK?
Hey, I thought we'd go to the market, if you felt up to it.
I don't even know what you like anymore.
Mom used to make my eggs soft scrambled.
After breakfast, do you think you can take me somewhere?
I'd love something to read that's not for 12-year-olds.
It's like they've never seen a pretty girl before.
What can I say? Family business.
She's down at Brown. She's a freshman.
So what's it like being back home?
Hey, would you like a selfie or maybe an autograph?
Dad, this is Noah. I went to school with his sister.
Well, listen, I really have to be going.
but if you need anything or any help with the local paparazzi,
It's good to meet you. Bye, Mr. Shaw.
See? I told you everything was gonna be fine.
[Mr. Shaw] Honey, it's OK, it's OK.
[Mr. Shaw] Well, shouldn't somebody come out here check it out?
It was a threat against my daughter!
Well, you know what? Forget it!
They don't have the time or the resources to dedicate to something like this.
You know what? I'm gonna go to the garage.
I might have a piece of wood big enough to cover that glass.
Promise me you'll just try to calm down.
When you have a daughter, you'll understand.
[man of TV] Thank you very much. Coming up on News 5,
more information on the tragic death of a local lawyer
who apparently fell out an upper story window
of his Eastborough office last night.
[woman on TV] Steven, who was 28, is described by his colleagues
as a hardworking and thoughtful young attorney.
many remember Steven as a bright and ambitious student
who delivered pizzas while putting himself through law school.
[man on TV] We'll talk with the man who saw it happen.
Plus, your five day weather for...
[man] There is no easy way to describe the loss of someone like Steven,
someone with such hope and promise for the future.
A light that shined so brightly, but could be snuffed out so easily.
Whatever problems Steven had in this world,
whatever demons he may have been facing,
we can find comfort and solace
in the fact that his soul is now in a better place,
a place where love and peace are eternal,
where there is no pain and suffering.
And we know that one day we shall be reunited with him,
"I lift up my eyes to the hills.
Where does my help come from?
My help comes from the Lord,
the maker of heaven and Earth."
we now return Steven to the Earth,
This must feel familiar for you.
It would've been her birthday today, you know that?
Well, she's in a graveyard nearby if you wanna pay your respects.
I'm sure she'd love to hear from you.
I didn't do anything to her, and you know it.
Funny, because there was only one person holding the knife that killed her,
[Noah] Hey, hey, hey, forget it. They're not worth the aggravation.
You don't know what it's like.
Maybe not, but my bitch meter is pretty reliable.
Actually, I could use a favor.
Can you give me photos of Steven's body?
You know what the witness said.
My dad would have my badge.
I won't say anything to anybody. I swear.
Let her go! Let her go!
The next-door neighbor called and said she thought
someone was trying to break into my house.
I'm so... I'm sorry. I didn't...
I thought the place was empty.
and you have to believe me.
I heard all about the evil ghost man or whatever you said it was.
I'm here to find the answers.
You may have convinced everybody else that you're crazy,
but I know exactly what you are.
That is the sound of karma.
I'd leave before they get here, if I were you.
-This is Noah. -[Olivia] Jill. Six years ago.
The face, contorted body, it's the same.
What if he's coming after everyone who was in the house?
[Noah] Look, you wanted to see photos, I sent you photos.
You want my advice? Drop it.
One more favor. Can you look up the file on Jill?
if she had any broken bones too.
I told you, Steven fell out a window.
All right, I'll think about it, but I gotta run, OK?
[woman on PA] Dr. Wilson, 1878. Dr. Wilson, 1878.
Why are you digging up that old case?
I ran into Olivia Shaw at the Sanderson funeral yesterday.
She tell you how they found her standing over Jill's body?
holding the knife that matched the stab wounds?
It says here the victim had multiple broken bones.
You don't think that was relevant to bring up in court?
Olivia pushed her down the stairs.
Yeah. What about the intruder Olivia said she saw?
We questioned all the neighbors on the block. No one saw anyone.
You know, your sister was supposed to be there that night.
Could've been her picture in that file.
Do yourself a favor, son. Stay away from Olivia Shaw.
Table four says they've been waiting five minutes for coffee.
I'm on it, I'm on it. [sighs]
Can you do me a favor and refill number four?
OK, what can I get for--
I think the Crooked Man is back.
I saw a picture of Steven's body.
Whatever happened to him, it looked just like Jill.
Violet says I'm not supposed to listen to you.
She says you're dangerous and unstable.
She's just trying to protect herself.
Charlotte, do you really think I killed Jill?
[woman on TV] Eastborough Police are investigating
the tragic death of Grace Hutchinson.
Our investigators say it initially looked like suicide.
They are not ready to make that claim just yet.
...say there is no way this career woman and mother
Investigators say the tragic death of Hutchinson's teenage daughter...
Everyone who was there that night is dying.
We need to let everyone know.
Toss your bike in the back. I'll drive.
-I'm working. -Violet, Jill's mother died last night.
Let me guess. The boogeyman did it?
Kind of a coincidence, don't you think?
All of this happening just as I get back into town?
You're not actually listening to this, are you?
it looked like just like what happened to Jill.
What did happen to Jill, Olive?
What I remember was a stupid, childish game,
and my best friend being found dead.
Look, you don't think I get it.
If I'm the girl who killed Jill,
then none of this was your fault.
But if I'm right, and the Crooked Man is back--
What, Olivia? What do you suggest we do?
Go into hiding because you think something you did six years ago
has come back to kill us?
Come on, you don't really believe this, do you?
Tell me, have you seen or experienced anything strange lately?
This is not a joke, Violet!
But if you're right, and if your little homecoming
has somehow brought this thing back,
then there's really only one answer, isn't there?
I have to get back to work.
Just--Just do me one favor, OK?
-Please stay out of the dark. -Olive, let's go.
Just make sure you're always in the light, no matter what!
-No one's seen her in years. -I'll be right back.
Do you know when she'll be back?
She doesn't want to see you.
It's really important that I speak to your daughter.
Wait. So the babysitter's the last one?
Assuming we even know how to find her.
-This is taking way too long. -I know. Come on.
Excuse us, excuse me, sorry. Sorry. Gotta get through.
Please, please, our friend is in danger.
Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome to the stage
Good evening, Eastborough. Thanks for coming out tonight.
It's good to be back in my hometown.
♪ Still on my mind Haunted by memories ♪
♪ As in falling through time Just like raindrops ♪
♪ For those of us lost with our hearts ♪
♪ Won't ever let go like a shadow ♪
♪ Can never let go of this heart ♪
We have to get back there.
-You got a pass? -She's a friend of ours.
It's all in your head. It's all in your head.
You two can't take a hint.
We think she might be in trouble.
I can't comment on whether it was a suicide or not
You know how long it took my dad to get off the case?
mentioned that the two had recently displayed
a fascination for an Internet meme known as the Crooked Man."
There's gotta be at least 50 stories here:
The original site was taken down.
But according to this, a lot of people had recited that rhyme.
I thought maybe there might be some information
on how to stop this thing.
Unfortunately, there's no contact information listed or anything.
-I have an idea. Come on. -Where are we going?
So can you find whoever put up that website or not?
All you have to do is put the domain into a Whois search,
and you should get what you need.
Got a P.O. box in Leveritt.
Looks like whoever did this wanted their privacy.
But that should be pretty easy for you to trace, right?
I thought you said this was going to be hard.
We're cyber forensics. We can do anything.
All I have to do is go into the system,
find out who registered the box, and...
It's been abandoned for three years.
Most computers automatically imprint their files
with a level of metadata, such as who created them and where.
So, for example, if the site has any photos,
I can find out where the computer was that posted them.
I'm sorry I told everyone you were crazy,
and I'm sorry I didn't support you all those years ago,
but I am not going to sit around and wait to die!
This guy maybe will have some answers for us.
Is that gonna help Jill or Jill's mom or Mia?
What do you mean, she's not coming?
What if you're wrong? What if you can't stop it?
I do know staying here won't.
Come with me. You don't need to be a part of this.
Yes, I do. We've been hiding too long.
-Olivia, what are you doing here? -I need to talk to you.
Not until I talk to you first. It's important.
You can't just come in here and go through my stuff.
Look, there's a site I found.
Dozens of cases just like ours.
Noah had a friend at the police station track down whoever put the site up.
If they've been doing all the research,
then-then maybe they know how to stop it.
This is why I need you to come with me.
Mother says never leave the house without her.
this could be our chance to finally fix what we did.
We'll crack a window. Come on.
-[man] What are you doing here? -[all gasp]
Not many people have come face to face with the Crooked Man and survived.
That's why you're here, isn't it?
To find someone who can give you all the answers.
Let's start with what this thing is and where it came from.
a writer researching legends and folklore
all referring to the same thing.
He called it the Crooked Man.
Imagine a death sentence that no mortal could escape,
that no human law could pardon,
bringing certain death to anyone who dare summon it.
It probably started as an tribal incantation.
The words were translated and passed down through the ages,
Over the years, it was transcribed and studied.
Part of it was even turned into a nursery rhyme.
And with that, the proverbial Pandora's Box was out there.
The Crooked Man now belonged to the world.
You were the one that put it up on Creepyhollow.
You can take down content, but it never really goes away.
By the time I realized what was happening,
that... that the Crooked Man was real,
I tried to get back online to warn people.
Four people in our town are dead!
And not a minute goes by where I'm not tormented by what I did.
I'm up in that sanctuary every day,
praying for the souls of the people I killed.
Now, ever since I came back...
now that all who were marked have returned and reunited,
I tried to get you to leave before he returned.
Too many people have died now.
There's no order, no rhyme, no reason.
Where there's darkness, he will be there.
But there has to be a way to stop him, right?
If you have been cursed by the Crooked Man,
[whispering] Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name,
thy kingdom come, thy will be done--
-There's something I have to do. -Wait. Hey, where--
♪ There was a Crooked Man And he walked a crooked mile ♪
♪ He found a crooked sixpence Upon a crooked stile ♪
♪ He bought a crooked cat Which caught a crooked mouse ♪
♪ And they all lived together In a little crooked house ♪
♪ When you sang his crooked rhyme ♪
♪ Down your crooked paths he follows ♪
♪ When he sets his crooked gaze ♪
Your dad said you'd be here.
Noah, how do you have this?
I have to tell you something...
My sister was supposed to be there.
I was on my way home from basketball practice,
and I thought-- I thought I'd swing by and give 'em a little scare, you know.
But by the time I got there, I realized she wasn't there.
And then when the lights went off, I got so scared that I would be seen, so I left.
Noah, I am so sorry. I had no idea.
But it's gonna be OK now, right?
Because you figured out where the website came from,
so you're gonna make it stop.
As long as we stay out of the dark, we should be OK.
Come on. I have an idea.
"Only with this crooked song shall the Crooked Man yield."
At first, I thought it was talking about the rhyme itself.
But what if it literally means "song"?
What if this music box is the key to the whole thing?
Milo said there was a writer in the 1800s
who was doing research on old legends
and found out about the Crooked Man.
and he accidentally summoned the Crooked Man.
If this box is out there,
we might be able to stop this thing.
All we have to do is find it.
We have to turn around. Now.
Olivia and I have been together the whole time.
[Police Officer] Five people are dead, Noah.
You saw the body. You think she did that to herself?
Please tell me you're not drinking the fruit punch.
-I know it sounds crazy. -You are a police officer.
-[Noah] I know what I saw! -OK. Here's what's gonna happen.
-You're not listening. -You're gonna take her down
-to the police station, OK? -You're gonna arrest her?
I'm gonna come down there and talk to her as soon as I'm done here.
Do you want me to have somebody else do this?
How could she have felt so helpless?
-You can't do this! -Just get in the car, please.
until my father realizes where we're going.
So where do we go now?
Looks like a place a professor would live.
[woman] Well, it's always nice to meet some of dad's former students.
He always spoke so highly of you and your mom.
I thought, since we happened to be in the area,
that we should pay our respects.
Oh, you found Milo, I see.
He was my dad's teaching assistant for years.
Which--which class of his did you take again?
Yeah. That was one of his favorites.
He always would tell the most interesting stories.
He would make you feel like you were right in the middle of it all.
It must've been amazing, growing up with a father like that,
all the stories he must have had.
To tell you the truth, yeah, he saved most of that for his students.
I can only imagine all the things he must have left behind.
I heard he had quite the collection.
Some of these items must be pretty valuable.
[woman] Yeah, well, you can't put a price on your father's memory.
That was one of his more recent finds.
I remember him talking about it.
what, were you 12 years old when he still taught that class?
And second of all, he never would've spoken very highly of me.
so do you wanna tell me what you're really doing here?
Have you heard the rhyme about the Crooked Man?
[scoffs] Of course. My father wrote a book about the author.
Milo posted the means to summon him online.
and unless we can figure out how to undo our mistake,
We believe this box might be the only way to stop it.
WANTED BY POLICE NOAH HARRIS OLIVIA SHAW
Something that I have not shown anyone.
But when I--when I found my father's body in the classroom...
We just need to borrow the box.
You get that son of a bitch.
[woman on TV] Noah Harris' black SUV
was reportedly seen early this morning heading north.
Harris and Olivia Shaw are being sought by police
in connection with last night's brutal slaying that--
I always knew she was trouble.
Dear Lord, bless this food that we are about to eat
Looks like a storm is coming in.
-I am going to check the breakers. -No! I mean... I'll come with you.
You know, maybe it's-it's the whole block.
There's nothing there. There's nothing there.
[Olivia] For six years, her mother tried everything she could,
and probably more than she should, to keep Alice safe.
How many people have died because of me?
You're the one that's trying to save them.
when I touched the music box, he called my name.
And it wasn't the first time.
This is all my fault. All of this.
-He's taunting me. -No, no, no, you can't think like that.
No, I killed them, Noah. I killed all of them!
You think she can hear me? She's in a coma because of me.
Don't you understand? Because of me!
-Don't you ever turn the light off! Ever! -She's just a little tired. Excuse us.
I'm the one who started it. I'm the one who needs to end it.
[exhales] The music box, it showed me something.
A crooked house. I think that's where we have to find him.
Did it show you where it was?
Uh... All I saw were woods.
Were there any specific characteristics or landmarks? Anything specific?
But--But I did notice two large rocks and giant pine tree.
-Come here. Come here. -What are you doing?
[Noah] I was a cub scout when I was a kid.
One day my troop went for a hike through this park.
We found this clearing and two rocks.
This is exactly what I remember.
That house was not there a minute ago.
-[Noah] What are you doing? -Making a call.

We know that when you recite the poem,
And so the box must serve the same purpose.
and take him back, we've got...
To play it backwards! OK, OK!
